sect1.title: Standard Filter Classes
sect1.para: Zend Framework comes with a standard set of filters, which are ready for you to use.

sect2.title: BaseName
sect2.para: Given a string containing a path to a file, this filter will return the base name of the file

sect2.title: Digits
sect2.para: Returns the string $value, removing all but digit characters.

sect2.title: Dir
sect2.para: Returns directory name component of path.

sect2.title: HtmlEntities
sect2.para: Returns the string $value, converting characters to their corresponding HTML entity equivalents where they exist.

sect2.title: StringTrim
sect2.para: Returns the string $value with characters stripped from the beginning and end.

sect2.title: StripNewlines
sect2.para: Returns the string $value without any newline control characters.

sect2.title: StripTags
sect2.para: This filter returns the input string, with all HTML and PHP tags stripped from it, except those that have been explicitly allowed. In addition to the ability to specify which tags are allowed, developers can specify which attributes are allowed across all allowed tags and for specific tags only.
